security: This document reveals details about covert operations and assassination discussions. Specifically, the testimony mentions instructions to 'get rid of Castro' without limitations, discussions involving General Lansdale, and the creation of a propaganda film to discredit Sukarno. Disclosing these details could expose covert actions and damage international relations. For example, Halpern states, 'Mr. Bissell said he had recently and he didn't specify the date or the time he had recently been chewed out in the Cabinet Room of the White House by both the President and the Attorney General for, as he put it, sitting on his ass and not doing anything about getting rid of Castro and the Castro regime.'
summary: This document is a transcript of the testimony of Samuel Halpern given on June 18, 1975, before the SSCIA. Halpern discusses Operation Mongoose, instructions to 'get rid of Castro' without limitations, involvement of General Lansdale, and a propaganda film intended to discredit Sukarno.
summary_one_paragraph: Samuel Halpern testified before the SSCIA on June 18, 1975, providing insights into Operation Mongoose and efforts to overthrow Fidel Castro's regime. He recounted instructions from Mr. Bissell, who conveyed pressure from the President and Attorney General to aggressively 'get rid of Castro,' indicating that no tactics were off-limits. Halpern detailed his involvement with General Lansdale in a government-wide effort to remove Castro, the introduction of Mr. Helms as the key figure on Cuba, and described a propaganda film created to undermine Sukarno's image. The transcript reveals discussions about assassination as a potential device, although Halpern stated it was never explicitly mentioned, and covers various operational details, including the recruitment and activities of agents.
title: Testimony of Samuel Halpern
